summary: PRRSV is caused by porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome virus (PRRSV) it is an enveloped positive-strand RNA virus belonging to the family Arteriviridae, order Nidovirales (14) the PRRSV genome encodes 7 structural proteins and 14 nonstructural proteins (51) IL-15 is a pleiotropic cytokine involved in a wide range of biological activities. it is produced by a variety of cell types including activated monocytes, macrophages, dendritic cells, epithelial cells, microglial cells, and astrocytes (8). IL-15 receptor shares the IL-2 and chain (IL-15/IL-2R) with IL-2 receptor complex. IL-15 regulates the number of the memory and nave CD8+ T cells. PRRSV induces a persistent viral infection, suggesting an inefficient cellular immune response. cytotoxic function of CD8+ and NK cells is downregulated. PRRSV N protein was proved to be involved in IL-15 production. we further cloned and identified a PRRSV-inducible region in the porcine IL-15 promoter. this region consists of IFN regulatory factor element (IRF-E) and NF-B motifs. monocytes from PBMC were cultured in RPMI 1640 medium. cells were washed with 10% FBS, recombinant porcine granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor. at day 6, lipopolysaccharide (LPS) was added (1 g/ml) (Sigma) IL-15 gene expression was normalized to glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH) and presented as fold induction relative to medium control. NF-B motif is critical for PRRSV-induced IL-15 production. NF-B signaling pathways significantly reduced IL-15 production in these cells. we also showed that PRRSV N protein could induce IL-15 in porcine IL-15 promoter. IL-15 release was reduced significantly by UV inactivation. NF-B could be activated 30 min after PRRSV inoculation. it was believed that this activation was independent of virus replication. however, the HP-PRRSV strain HV-induced IL-15 production was dramatically delayed, as IL-15 mRNA expression was not increased until 36 h postinfection. treatment of porcine alveolar macrophages with NF-B inhibitor significantly reduced IL-15 production compared with what was seen for cells infected by PRRSV only. NF-B defines a family of dimeric transcription factors, and the predominant species of the NF-B family is the p50–p65 complex, which is retained in the cytoplasm by its inhibitor IB (27). the IRF-E motif was demonstrated to be an essential element of the virus-inducible region of the mouse IL-15 promoter. deletion of the IRF-E motif dramatically reduced promoter activity in mouse cell line L929 infected by Newcastle disease virus (8). however, deletion of the IRF-E binding site only slightly reduced promoter activity induced by PRRSV and PRRSV N protein. the luciferase activity of full-length IL-15 promoter was low compared to that of the truncated (372/77) promoter. however, we suspect that other regulatory transcription elements may exist at the region of 1023/372. IL-15 knockout mice were significantly less antigen-specific CD44+CD8+ T cells in the lungs. however, the survival rate of these mice was reduced by adoptive transfer of the CD8+ T cells. IL-15-dependent CD8+ T cells are at least partially responsible for the pathogenesis of acute pneumonia caused by influenza A virus (42) further research will provide new insights into the molecular mechanism controlling the IL-15 production induced by PRRSV infection.
